net.doo.snap.camera

Class AutoSnappingController

  • net.doo.snap.camera.AutoSnappingController
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    WorkflowAutoSnappingController

    public class AutoSnappingController

    Controls auto-snapping process by observing contour detection results from class ContourDetectorFrameHandler.

    See Also:
    class ContourDetectorFrameHandler

    • Method Detail

      • attach

        public static AutoSnappingController attach(ScanbotCameraView cameraView)

        Same as net.doo.snap.camera.AutoSnappingController$attach(net.doo.snap.camera.ScanbotCameraView,io.scanbot.sdk.contourdetector.ContourDetectorFrameHandler), but creates new class ContourDetectorFrameHandler which will be attached to camera.

        Use this method if you don't need to control contour detection routine. However, be careful to not accidentally attach several class ContourDetectorFrameHandler to camera therefore causing contour detection to be executed more than once.

        See Also:
        net.doo.snap.camera.AutoSnappingController$attach(net.doo.snap.camera.ScanbotCameraView,io.scanbot.sdk.contourdetector.ContourDetectorFrameHandler), class ContourDetectorFrameHandler, class ContourDetectorFrameHandler

      • attach

        public static AutoSnappingController attach(ScanbotCameraView cameraView,
                                            ContourDetectorFrameHandler contourDetectorFrameHandler)

        Convenience method for attaching class AutoSnappingController to camera view and class ContourDetectorFrameHandler.

        Auto-snapping is enabled by default as soon as you create new instance of class AutoSnappingController. You can manually enable or disable auto-snapping by calling net.doo.snap.camera.AutoSnappingController$setEnabled(kotlin.Boolean).

        Parameters:
        cameraView - camera view which is used for snapping
        contourDetectorFrameHandler - class ContourDetectorFrameHandler which will be attached to camera.
        Returns:
        org.jetbrains.dokka.NodeRenderContent@b2d6ee1: new class AutoSnappingController
        See Also:
        class AutoSnappingController, class ContourDetectorFrameHandler, class AutoSnappingController, net.doo.snap.camera.AutoSnappingController$setEnabled(kotlin.Boolean)

      • onDetectionOK

        protected void onDetectionOK(java.util.List<android.graphics.PointF> polygon)

      • setEnabled

        public void setEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Parameters:
        enabled - true to enable auto-snapping. false to disable auto-snapping.

      • setForceAutofocusBeforeSnap

        public void setForceAutofocusBeforeSnap(boolean enabled)
        Parameters:
        enabled - true to enable auto focus before snapping. false to set default behavior.

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled()
        Returns:
        org.jetbrains.dokka.NodeRenderContent@67782ae3: true if auto-snapping is enabled. false if auto-snapping is disabled.

      • setSensitivity

        public void setSensitivity(float sensitivity)

        Changes sensitivity of auto-snapping. That is: the more sensitive it is the faster it shoots.

        Sensitivity must be within [0..1] range. A value of 1.0 triggers automatic capturing immediately, a value of 0.0 delays the automatic by 3 seconds.

        The default value is 0.66 (1 sec)

        Parameters:
        sensitivity - sensitivity within [0..1] range. If given value is outside of this range it is clamped

      • setIgnoreBadAspectRatio

        public void setIgnoreBadAspectRatio(boolean ignoreBadAspectRatio)

        Sets flag which enables/disables BadAspectRatio detection ignorance. By default - false

      • setAutoSnappingCallback

        public void setAutoSnappingCallback(net.doo.snap.camera.AutoSnappingController.AutoSnappingCallback callback)
        Parameters:
        callback - callback which will be called right before auto-snapping routine takes picture.
